newsitem.title: LATVIA: Latvian shares mixed ahead of H1 results.
newsitem.headline: Latvian shares mixed ahead of H1 results.

text.p: Latvian shares were mixed in sluggish summer trade on Wednesday ahead of H1 results, dealers said.
Overall market volume was only 46,000 lats as the bourse's recently introduced index rose by 0.19 percent to 384.32. The Rietumu index eased .004 percent to 152.31.
Dealers said they hoped the seasonal downturn would be reversed when six-month results, due out soon, are released.
"The market is expecting generally good results from the few blue chips, such as Unibanka and Kaija fish cannery," said one dealer.
He added that the market was anxiously waiting for the half year results from bourse newcomer Olainfarm, a pharmaceutical company, which rose to 2.55 lats from 2.49 lats in trade of 12,700 lats.

The stock, which debuted on the bourse a few weeks ago, has bounced up and down and dealers remain divided over its value. Some brokers say that someone seems to be trying to support it over 2.50 lats.
The official list was mixed, with two shares rising, two easing and Unibanka holding steady at 3.35 lats in trade of 16,800 lats.
The market, which lacks big institutional and portfolio investors, remains largely divorced from trends elsewhere in Europe.
